module: Software Testing and Quality Assurance Quiz

questions.question: Cyclomatic complexity measures:
Bottom-up integration testing starts with:
Which metric best evaluates decision logic complexity in a module?
Which is an example of a process metric?
Reviews during development primarily aim to:
Which approach tests a software's internal logic?
Which technique relies on analogy and experience for estimating effort?
Which of the following is NOT a valid benefit of using metrics in software engineering?
Which metric can be used to assess productivity in terms of code produced?
Top-down integration testing proceeds by:

options.a: Testing the entire system at once
options.b: Starting with the main control module and integrating down

questions.question: Which of the following is a direct output of estimation processes?
A formal review involving detailed preparation and defect logging is called:
Formal technical reviews (FTRs) are mainly conducted to:
How do process metrics benefit software development teams?
Which review technique is informal and typically done by a single peer?
Which of the following is NOT a quality attribute defined by ISO 9126?
Which of the following activities is NOT typically part of software quality assurance?
Boundary value analysis is an example of:
Which review type is typically informal and done by a peer?
What is the primary intent of software testing according to Pressman?

options.a: To prove the software is error-free
options.b: To find errors prior to delivery

questions.question: According to Boehm, 'Are we building the product right?' refers to:
In software testing strategy, what does 'testing-in-the-small' primarily focus on for conventional software?
Which of these is NOT a strategic issue in software testing mentioned by Pressman?

options.a: Specify product requirements in a quantifiable manner
options.c: Maximize the number of test cases executed
options.d: Develop a continuous improvement approach for the testing process

questions.question: What is the role of a 'stub' in a unit test environment?

options.a: To call the module being tested
options.b: To simulate modules called by the module under test

questions.question: The 'big bang' approach is a strategy for which type of testing?
What is the primary purpose of regression testing?

options.b: To ensure changes have not introduced unintended side effects

questions.question: Smoke testing is often associated with:
In Object-Oriented testing, 'thread-based testing' integrates classes required to respond to:
Which type of testing forces the software to fail in various ways to verify recovery procedures?
The primary aim of debugging is to:

options.b: Diagnose and correct the cause of known errors

questions.question: Which of the following is a reason why debugging can be difficult, according to Pressman?

options.a: Symptoms and causes are always co-located
options.c: Symptoms may disappear when another problem is fixed
options.d: The cause is always a single, clear error

questions.question: One of the outcomes derived from a software process for measurement purposes is:

options.b: The number of developers on the team
options.c: Measures of errors uncovered before release
options.d: The specific hardware used for development

questions.question: According to Pressman, which guideline is important when interpreting metrics data?

options.a: Use metrics to appraise individuals publicly
options.b: Never provide feedback to individuals who collect measures
options.c: Use common sense and organizational sensitivity
options.d: Obsess on a single metric for detailed analysis

questions.question: Defect Removal Efficiency (DRE) is an example of what type of process metric?
Which of these is a typical size-oriented metric?
A key advantage of Function Point (FP) metrics over LOC metrics is that FPs are:
The Defect Removal Efficiency (DRE) formula E / (E + D) uses 'D' to represent:

options.b: Number of defects found after delivery

questions.question: Establishing an explicit measurement goal is the first step in which paradigm?
Which of the following is a primary task in the software project planning process according to Pressman?
Estimation of resources, cost, and schedule for a software project primarily requires:

options.c: Experience and access to good historical information

questions.question: Software scope describes functions, features, data, content, and also:

options.a: The specific algorithms to be used

questions.question: Which estimation technique involves breaking down a task and estimating effort for each sub-task?
The accuracy of an estimation is predicated on:

options.a: The number of lines of code written
options.b: The stability of product requirements and the support environment
options.c: The complexity of the database schema

questions.question: Process-based estimation derives effort from:

options.b: The complexity of the user interface
options.c: Framework activities applied to application functions

questions.question: COCOMO II's 'Application composition model' is used during which stage of software engineering?

options.b: After the architecture is fully defined
options.c: Early stages, when prototyping and technology evaluation are key

questions.question: In the Software Equation, 'P' represents:
When estimating for Agile projects, each user scenario is typically:

options.a: Estimated as a single large block of work
options.c: Considered separately and decomposed into tasks
options.d: Estimated only by the project manager

questions.question: In a make-buy decision, computing expected cost involves:

options.a: Choosing the option with the lowest initial price
options.b: Summing path probabilities multiplied by estimated path costs
options.c: Ignoring the probability of different outcomes
options.d: Only considering the cost to build in-house

questions.question: Which of the 'Golden Rules' of UI design emphasizes providing undoable actions?
The user's mental image of what the interface is, is known as the:
A Swimlane Diagram in UI analysis is primarily used to:

options.b: Illustrate roles and task flow across them in a workflow
options.c: Detail screen layout and color palettes
options.d: Map user objectives to interface actions

questions.question: Tognozzi suggests that effective Web/Mobile App interfaces should:

options.a: Expose all technical workings of the system to the user
options.b: Require maximum information from users to perform tasks
options.d: Focus on the efficiency of the software engineer

questions.question: The UI design principle 'Fittâ€™s Law' relates to:

options.b: The time to acquire a target based on distance and size
options.d: The anticipation of the user's next move

questions.question: Which of the following is a pragmatic view of quality, suggesting quality is tied to inherent characteristics of a product?
Which of Garvin's Quality Dimensions refers to whether software delivers all features and capability without failure?
The costs associated with quality planning, formal technical reviews, and training are known as:
According to Pressman, an 'error' is a quality problem found:

options.a: Only after the software has been released
options.b: Before the software is released to end users

questions.question: In the context of review metrics, WPS stands for:
Which FTR player is responsible for evaluating the product for readiness and distributing materials?
What is a key guideline for conducting a review?

options.a: Focus on critiquing the producer's abilities
options.b: Attempt to solve every problem noted during the meeting
options.c: Encourage lengthy debate and rebuttal on each point
options.d: Review the product, not the producer

questions.question: Which SQA element involves preparing an SQA plan for a project, identifying evaluations and audits to be performed?
The Six Sigma methodology step that involves collecting defect metrics to determine current quality performance is:
Software Availability is calculated as:
The Goal/Question/Metric (GQM) paradigm is used for:
Which of the following is an information domain value used in Function Point calculation?
The CK metric 'DIT' stands for:
Halstead's Software Science metrics are predicated on the number of:
The Software Maturity Index (SMI) approaching 1.0 indicates that the product is:
What is defect propagation in the context of defect amplification?

options.b: Errors being carried forward into later phases
options.c: The initial introduction of an error
options.d: Reducing the number of defects through reviews

questions.question: A higher Defect Amplification Ratio (DAR) for a specific phase indicates:

options.a: Very effective defect detection in that phase
options.b: Defects are not being detected effectively in that phase
options.c: The phase introduced very few defects
options.d: All defects from previous phases were caught

questions.question: What is the primary role of end-users in User Acceptance Testing (UAT)?

options.a: To write the test plan and test cases
options.b: To fix defects found during testing
options.c: To test the system in a real-world scenario and provide feedback

questions.question: Which of the following is a typical UAT Entry Criterion?

options.b: The marketing campaign is ready to launch
options.c: No major critical defects are present from prior testing phases
options.d: The development team has signed off on the code

questions.question: In UAT, 'Exploratory Testing' involves:

options.b: Users exploring the system to identify unexpected issues
options.d: Testing only the graphical user interface

questions.question: A 'Critical' severity defect in UAT typically means:

options.a: A minor UI or cosmetic issue
options.b: Functionality is affected but a workaround exists
options.c: A system crash or major functionality failure
